the correct statements about a lessons report are:

It is used to pass on lessons that may be applied to other projects.
It can be produced at any time during the project.

D = correct;
The correct answer is D. 1 and 4

Here's why:

1. It is used to pass on lessons that may be applied to other projects: This is a key purpose of the lessons report. It captures lessons learned during the project, both positive and negative, so that other projects can benefit from this experience. This helps to avoid repeating mistakes and to replicate successes.   

4. It provides the information needed to update the lessons log: The lessons log is a repository of lessons learned across multiple projects. The information from the lessons report is used to update this log, making the knowledge available to future projects.   

Why the other options are incorrect:

2. It can be produced at any time during the project: While lessons can be captured throughout the project, the lessons report is typically created towards the end of a project or stage.   
3. It identifies when post-project benefits reviews will be held: This information is usually included in the project plan or the benefits management approach, not the lessons report.

A. 

Statement 1 is correct because a lessons report is designed to capture valuable insights and lessons learned from the project that can be shared and applied to other projects.
Statement 2 is correct because a lessons report can indeed be produced at any time, often at the end of a stage, the end of the project, or when a significant lesson is identified.
